PARAGRAPH.STRING: ([Tibetan: [], Wylie: Bstan-'dzin Rgya-mtsho]) (b. July 6 1935) is the fourteenth and current Dalai Lama, and as such,
is often referred to in Western media simply as the Dalai Lama, without any qualifiers. The fifth of sixteen children of a farming family in the Tibetan province of Amdo,
was proclaimed the tulku (rebirth) of the thirteenth Dalai Lama at the age of five. On November 17 1950, at the age of fifteen,
was enthroned as Tibet's Head of State and most important political ruler, while Tibet faced occupation by the forces of the People's Republic of China.
After the collapse of the Tibetan resistance movement in 1959,
was active in establishing the Central Tibetan Administration (the Tibetan government in exile) and seeking to preserve Tibetan culture and education among the thousands of refugees who accompanied
A charismatic figure and noted public speaker,
is the first Dalai Lama to travel to the West, where
has helped to spread Buddhism and to publicise the ideal of Free Tibet. In 1989,
was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
